page.title: 02Local History in Uxbridge
page.content: The name Uxbridge means the bridge over the Wixan.The Wixan were a saxon tribe and the bridge was over the River Colne,their boundary.The Crown and Treaty inn dates back to the 16th century and behind it is the Treaty House,where the commissioners of Charles I met representatives of Parliament to sue unsuccessfully for peace.A painting hanging in the Civic Centre,shows a banquet that resolved a quarrel between the local townsfolk and the Countess of Derby over market tolls.In 1798 the Grand Junction Canal was opened increasing trade for Uxbridge.In 1936 only one bus ran through Uxbridge,unlike today.In the 1970s the new Civic Centre was built.
